• Add syntax highlighter CSS file to your site
  • Wrap your code use 

	
	{% highlight js %}  
	your javascript code
	{% endhighlight %}

Code example

Example1, html 

	{% highlight js %}
	//example
	var adder = new Function("a", "b");
	adder(2, 6);
	{% endhighlight %}
output: 
1 //example
2   var adder = new Function("a", "b");
3   adder(2, 6);

Example2, html 

	{% highlight ruby %}
	def show
	@widget = Widget(params[:id])
	respond_to do |format|
	format.html # show.html.erb
	format.json { render json: @widget }
	end
	end
	{% endhighlight %}
output: 
1 def show
2 	@widget = Widget(params[:id])
3 	respond_to do |format|
4 	format.html # show.html.erb
5 	format.json { render json: @widget }
6 	end
7 	end

Add line number to your code

simple way: 

	{% highlight ruby linenos%}
	def show
	@widget = Widget(params[:id])
	{% endhighlight %}

Seperate the line number with your code, add the following to your css: 

1 .highlight .lineno { color: #ccc; display:inline-block; padding: 0 5px; border-right:1px solid #ccc; }
2 .highlight pre code { display: block; white-space: pre; overflow-x: auto; word-wrap: normal; }

Make your line number unselectable, add the following css

1 .highlight .lineno {-webkit-user-select: none;-moz-user-select: none; -o-user-select: none;} 
2 .lineno::-moz-selection {background-color: transparent;} /* Mozilla specific */
3 .lineno::selection {background-color: transparent;} /* Other major browsers */
